com.here.android.mpa.ar

Class ARController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.here.android.mpa.ar.ARController

  • public final class ARController
extends java.lang.Object
    The ARController class serves as a facade for LiveSight functionality. It contains methods and callbacks for controlling and customizing LiveSight behavior.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  ARController.CameraParams
      Encapsulates parameters which affect the device camera.
      class  ARController.DownViewParams
      Encapsulates parameters which affect the Down view.
      static class  ARController.Error
      AR Error codes
      class  ARController.FilterParams
      Encapsulates parameters which affect data filtering.
      class  ARController.IconParams
      Encapsulates parameters which affect the icons of an ARObject.
      class  ARController.InfoParams
      Encapsulates parameters which affect the info of an ARObject.
      class  ARController.IntroAnimationParams
      Encapsulates parameters which affect the Intro Animation.

      Listener for Camera view entered event.

      Listener for pose update events.

      Listener for the post draw event.

      Listener for the pre draw event.

      Listener for the map pre draw event.

      Listener for radar update events.

      Listener for sensor calibration events.

      Listener for tap events.
      static interface  ARController.OnTouchDownListener
      Listener for touch down events.
      static interface  ARController.OnTouchUpListener
      Listener for touch up events.
      static class  ARController.ProjectionType
      Type of the projection used by the LiveSight engine while displaying ARObjects in the camera/UP view.
      class  ARController.SelectedItemParams
      Encapsulates parameters which affect ARObjects which are in the selected or non selected states.
      static class  ARController.TapFeedbackType
      Type of tap feedback animation
      class  ARController.UpViewParams
      Encapsulates parameters which affect the Up view.
      class  ARController.UpViewTransitionParams
      Encapsulates parameters which affect the Up view transition.
      static class  ARController.ViewType
      List of all views available in LiveSight

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public ARController.Error start()
        Start AR
        Returns:
        ARController.Error.NONE on success. Otherwise, one of the error codes in Error.

      • stop

        public ARController.Error stop(boolean withExitAnimation)
        Stop AR
        Parameters:
        withExitAnimation - If true, exit animation is used before stopping LiveSight.
        Returns:
        ARController.Error.NONE on success. Otherwise, one of the error codes in Error.

      • enableDownViewOrientation

        public void enableDownViewOrientation(boolean enabled)
        Enable/disable real time orientation changes of DOWN view. When true, down view is updated with the sensors's orientation data.
        Parameters:
        enabled - If true, DOWN view is constantly updated with sensor's data. Default: true.

      • forceLockedPitch

        public void forceLockedPitch(boolean locked)
        Force pitch to be locked
        Parameters:
        locked - Lock value

      • setMap

        public void setMap(Map map)
        Set Map to the ARController. ARController will handle transitions between views.
        Parameters:
        map - Existing Map object

      • addARObject

        public void addARObject(ARObject arObject)
        Add an ARObject that will be displayed in the Camera and Map view.
        Parameters:
        arObject - ARObject to add to the ARController

      • getObjectId

        public long getObjectId(ARObject arObject)
        Get ARObjects unique identifier.
        Parameters:
        arObject - ARObject to retrieve unique identifier for
        Returns:
        ARObjects unique identifier. -1 returned if object has not been found

      • focus

        public void focus(ARObject arObject)
        Focus an ARObject. Bring the object in front of other items and expand Info. The object becomes defocused automatically if other object is chosen to be focused. Only one object can be focused.

        Focus only has a visible affect on ARObjects which are in the Back plane.

        Parameters:
        arObject - ARObject to focus

      • defocus

        public void defocus()
        Defocus previously focused ARObject. Bring the object back to its position among all objects in Camera view.

      • press

        public ARObject press(android.graphics.PointF point)
        Press an ARObject. Render the item to simulate pressing.
        Parameters:
        point - PointF on the screen to press.
        Returns:
        Pressed ARObject. null if no object is located at point.

      • press

        public void press(ARObject arObject)
        Press an ARObject. Render the item to simulate pressing.
        Parameters:
        arObject - The ARObject to be marked as pressed

      • depress

        public void depress(ARObject arObject)
        Depress previously pressed ARObject. Render the item to simulate depressing.
        Parameters:
        arObject - The ARObject to be marked as no longer pressed

      • select

        public void select(ARObject arObject)
        Select an ARObject. Any item in Camera view can be in selected state. This implies that the item is rendered differently. The ARObject becomes unselected automatically if another ARObject is selected. Only one ARObject can be selected at a time.

        When selected: Details portion(if present) of the item collapses, background image replaces foreground image(if item is on foreground), item's image is scaled(if specified), item's opacity is changed(if specified), all non-selected items opacity(if specified) are changed as well.

        Parameters:
        arObject - The ARObject to be marked as selected
        See Also:
        ARController.SelectedItemParams.setOpacity(float), ARController.SelectedItemParams.setNonSelectedItemsOpacity(float)

      • unselect

        public void unselect()
        Unselect previously selected object.

        When unselected: Details portion(if present) expands, front image is used instead of background(if item is on foreground), item is scaled to normal size, all opacities change to default values.

        See Also:
        ARController.SelectedItemParams.setOpacity(float), ARController.SelectedItemParams.setNonSelectedItemsOpacity(float)

      • removeARObject

        public boolean removeARObject(ARObject arObject)
        Remove an ARObject from the Camera and Map view.
        Parameters:
        arObject - ARObject to remove
        Returns:
        True if map object is successfully removed from ARController. False otherwise.
        See Also:
        ARIconObject

      • showFrontItemsOnly

        public void showFrontItemsOnly(boolean show)
        Show only icons in the Front plane in Camera view.
        Parameters:
        show - If true, only front items will be displayed in Camera view

      • getObjects

        public java.util.List<ARObject> getObjects(android.graphics.PointF point)
        Get a list of ARObjects at the specified screen point.
        Parameters:
        point - Screen point to check for ARObjects
        Returns:
        List of ARObjects. null if no objects are located at point.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        List of ARObjects. null if no objects are located in rect.

      • pan

        public void pan(android.graphics.PointF from,
       android.graphics.PointF to)
        Pans the Camera view from one specified on-screen PointF to another.
        Parameters:
        from - An originating on-screen PointF (pre-pan)
        to - An on-screen PointF representing the end of the pan

      • showView

        public void showView(ARController.ViewType viewType)
        Show specified ARController.ViewType locking pitch in that view.
        Parameters:
        viewType - ViewType to show

      • getPose

        public ARPoseReading getPose()
        Get latest pose
        Returns:
        A ARPoseReading object representing the latest available pose

      • getPosition

        public GeoCoordinate getPosition()
        Get the last known position.
        Returns:
        GeoCoordinate representing the last known position or null if no position fix is available

      • getAccelerometerCalibrationStatus

        public int getAccelerometerCalibrationStatus()
        Get the accelerometer calibration status.

        Status can be one of the following values:

        • SensorManager.SENSOR_STATUS_UNRELIABLE
        • SensorManager.SENSOR_STATUS_ACCURACY_LOW
        • SensorManager.SENSOR_STATUS_ACCURACY_MEDIUM
        • SensorManager.SENSOR_STATUS_ACCURACY_HIGH
        Returns:
        the accelerometer calibration status

      • getCompassCalibrationStatus

        public int getCompassCalibrationStatus()
        Get the compass calibration status.

        Status can be one of the following values:

        • SensorManager.SENSOR_STATUS_UNRELIABLE
        • SensorManager.SENSOR_STATUS_ACCURACY_LOW
        • SensorManager.SENSOR_STATUS_ACCURACY_MEDIUM
        • SensorManager.SENSOR_STATUS_ACCURACY_HIGH
        Returns:
        the compass calibration status

      • getGyroscopeCalibrationStatus

        public int getGyroscopeCalibrationStatus()
        Get the gyroscope calibration status.

        Status can be one of the following values:

        • SensorManager.SENSOR_STATUS_UNRELIABLE
        • SensorManager.SENSOR_STATUS_ACCURACY_LOW
        • SensorManager.SENSOR_STATUS_ACCURACY_MEDIUM
        • SensorManager.SENSOR_STATUS_ACCURACY_HIGH
        Returns:
        the gyroscope calibration status

      • setAlternativeCenter

        public void setAlternativeCenter(GeoCoordinate coordinate)
        Set alternative to current GPS position to use for LiveSight. Passing null will cause LiveSight to resume using GPS position.
        Parameters:
        coordinate - GeoCoordinate representing alternative center to use
        See Also:
        isUsingAlternativeCenter()

      • isUsingAlternativeCenter

        public boolean isUsingAlternativeCenter()
        Checks to see if an alternative center is currently being used
        Returns:
        true if alternative center is used, false otherwise
        See Also:
        setAlternativeCenter(GeoCoordinate)

      • setUseDownIconsOnMap

        public void setUseDownIconsOnMap(boolean useDownIcons)
        Use Down icons in Map view in LiveSight
        Parameters:
        useDownIcons - Enable using Down icons in Map view of LiveSight. Default: false

      • setPlanesParameters

        public void setPlanesParameters(float frontNear,
                       float frontFar,
                       float backNear,
                       float backFar)
        Set front and back planes parameters - screen height ratios (0..1f)
        Parameters:
        frontNear - Front plane near screen height ratio
        frontFar - Front plane far screen height ratio
        backNear - Back plane near screen height ratio
        backFar - Back plane far screen height ratio

      • setTapArea

        public void setTapArea(int width,
              int height)
        Sets the tap area width and height. Whenever user touches the screen, a tap event is triggered. Whenever the user starts moving the finger on the screen, a pan event is triggered. The tap area is a rectangle having the initial touch point as the center. As long as the user moves the finger on the screen and the touch point is inside the tap area, no pan event will be triggered.The default tap area has a width and height of 51 pixels.
        Parameters:
        width - The tap area width in pixels
        height - The tap area height in pixels

      • setUpdateDistanceDelta

        public void setUpdateDistanceDelta(int delta)
        Sets the update distance delta.

        When the distance between the current center position and a new one is bigger than the update distance delta the AR layout will be updated.

        Parameters:
        delta - Distance delta in meters. Default: 10 meters.

      • getUpdateDistanceDelta

        public int getUpdateDistanceDelta()
        Get the update distance delta.
        Returns:
        Distance delta in meters.
        See Also:
        setUpdateDistanceDelta(int)

      • setTapFeedbackType

        public void setTapFeedbackType(ARController.TapFeedbackType type)
        Set tap feedback animation type.
        Parameters:
        type - A value of ARController.TapFeedbackType.
        See Also:
        ARController.TapFeedbackType

      • getTapFeedbackType

        public ARController.TapFeedbackType getTapFeedbackType()
        Get tap feedback animation type.
        Returns:
        A value of ARController.TapFeedbackType.

      • setProjectionType

        public void setProjectionType(ARController.ProjectionType type)
        Set Camera view ARController.ProjectionType

        Note: ARController.ProjectionType.DIRECT_3D is not currently supported.

        Parameters:
        type - A value of ProjectionType.

      • getProjectionType

        public ARController.ProjectionType getProjectionType()
        Get Camera view ARController.ProjectionType
        Returns:
        A value of ProjectionType

      • addOnCameraEnteredListener

        public void addOnCameraEnteredListener(ARController.OnCameraEnteredListener listener)
        Adds a ARController.OnCameraEnteredListener to this ARController to listen for the event triggered when Camera view is entered. This event is triggered just before the Camera view is entered.
        Parameters:
        listener - A ARController.OnCameraEnteredListener to add to the ARController
        See Also:
        removeOnCameraEnteredListener(OnCameraEnteredListener)

      • removeOnCameraEnteredListener

        public void removeOnCameraEnteredListener(ARController.OnCameraEnteredListener listener)
        Removes an existing ARController.OnCameraEnteredListener from this ARController.
        Parameters:
        listener - A ARController.OnCameraEnteredListener to remove from the ARController

      • addOnCameraExitedListener

        public void addOnCameraExitedListener(ARController.OnCameraExitedListener listener)
        Adds a ARController.OnCameraExitedListener to this ARController to listen for the event triggered when Camera view is exited. This event is triggered just after the Camera view is exited.
        Parameters:
        listener - A ARController.OnCameraExitedListener to add to the ARController
        See Also:
        removeOnCameraExitedListener(OnCameraExitedListener)

      • addOnPanListener

        public void addOnPanListener(ARController.OnPanListener listener)
